metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1249 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s core dump subsystem. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system. Only if patch 390031c94211 ("coredump: Use the vma snapshot in fill_files_note") not applied yet, then kernel could be affected.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
